alert.note: Alert for Northern Big Horn; Southern Big Horn; Southern Rosebud (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 6:32PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Big Horn and south central Rosebud Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 631 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northwest of Busby, or 24 miles east of Hardin, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Busby, Lame Deer, Muddy Cluster and Northern Cheyenne Indian Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southeastern Montana.

area.areaDesc: Northern Big Horn; Southern Big Horn; Southern Rosebud
